intro: Cachrys rutifolia, commonly known as the redstem cinquefoil, is a perennial shrub native to North America. It is characterized by its compound leaves, which are typically arranged in pairs along the stems. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. Its roots are fibrous and can form dense colonies, making it a hardy plant in various soil types. Cachrys rutifolia is often found in moist or wet environments such as swamps and stream banks.
